page.title: 18Changes in Farming
page.content: Major development of farm machinery has led to a reduction in the need for human labour. A survey showed that today only 10% of people in the Charing area are farm labourers but the parish records of the Victorian era show that 65% of working men were farm labourers then. Today we use chemical sprays to control weeds and disease. Oil-seed rape has become a major crop in this area. It is grown on seven of the eight crop-growing farms. Vegetable farming has diminished and there are no hops grown here now. From our school log book of the late 1800Â£s we know that many children were absent as they were hop picking. Farmers have amalgamated many of their fields so less ground is taken by hedges.
